There's 25 million people

Poverty is closer than we think

312.text:

to be unreasonable,

322.text:
There are actually four characteristics
for a social enterprise I want to share.

326.text:
The first is every social entrepreneur
has a theory of change,

329.text:
something they want
to change in this world.

332.text:
Impact is their major driver.
Impact is what starts it all.

336.text:
They want to create that change
through a viable business model,

341.text:
through a market-based solution,
which means they don't want

344.text:
to be dependent on subsidies,
and grants, or on the government.

347.text:
They want to build a market-based
solution, which also means

350.text:
that they can scale that solution
if they make their business grow,

354.text: and it means the solution is sustainable.

357.text:
The most ambitious ones
want systemic change,

361.text:
want that change to be much bigger
than their own enterprise.

364.text: So let's look at the Netherlands.

366.text:
Do we have social entrepreneurs
in the Netherlands? Yes, we do.

369.text:
Quite a few very impressive ones,

Text To Change is a social enterprise

and they wanted to use
mobile technology, SMS messaging,

387.text:

391.text:
to bring development,

First of all, you don't combine

398.text:

in the outskirts of Africa

410.text:

Text To Change has done
70 projects in 16 countries,

in Uganda they made
